messages.content: You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the purpose of Hedera Testnets?

The purpose of Hedera Testnets is to provide developers access to a free testing environment for Hedera network services, simulating the same development environment as the mainnet, including transaction fees, throttles, and available services.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
Where can I create a Hedera testnet or previewnet account?
You can create a Hedera testnet or previewnet account by visiting the Hedera Developer Portal at https://portal.hedera.com/login.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the purpose of the Preview Test Network?
The Preview Test Network provides developers with early exposure to features coming down the pipeline, offering insight into developments likely to be used in an upcoming release.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What services are available on the Test Network and Preview Test Network?
The available services include Cryptocurrency, Consensus Service, File Service, Smart Contract Service, and Token Service, all of which are limited on both networks.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What happens during a testnet reset?
During a testnet reset, all account, token, contract, topic, schedule, and file data are wiped, and developers will no longer have access to the state data from test network consensus nodes.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
How often are the mirror node and consensus node test network reset?
The mirror node and consensus node test network are scheduled to reset once a quarter.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What should developers do during a test network reset?

Developers should take note of the upcoming reset dates, have the ability to recreate test data for their application to minimize interruptions, and visit the Hedera Developer Portal to get a new testnet account ID after the reset.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
Where can developers subscribe to receive testnet reset notifications?
Developers can subscribe to the Hedera status page at https://status.hedera.com/ to receive testnet reset notifications.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the purpose of the test network throttles?
The test network throttles limit the number of transactions submitted to the network, ensuring that the network does not become overwhelmed with traffic.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
Can you provide an overview of the test network throttles for different network request types?

The test network throttles set limits for various network request types, such as Cryptocurrency Transactions, Consensus Transactions, Token Transactions, Schedule Transactions, File Transactions, Smart Contract Transactions, Queries, and Receipts.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the throttle for Cryptocurrency Transactions such as TransferTransaction?
The throttle for TransferTransaction, including tokens, is set at 10,000 transactions per second on the test network.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the throttle for Smart Contract Transactions like ContractCreateTransaction on the test network?
The throttle for ContractCreateTransaction is set at 350 transactions per second on the test network.
